candidates.body: Bump & release `deno_http` v0.43.1

candidates.title: perf(ext/http): faster is_content_compressible
candidates.body:
Cleanup + benches

Optimizing for the common case of "simple hits":
```
Before:
test compressible_complex_hit  ... bench:         113 ns/iter (+/- 3)
test compressible_complex_miss ... bench:         139 ns/iter (+/- 3)
test compressible_simple_hit   ... bench:          84 ns/iter (+/- 4)
test compressible_simple_miss  ... bench:          81 ns/iter (+/- 6)

After:
test compressible_complex_hit  ... bench:         126 ns/iter (+/- 1)
test compressible_complex_miss ... bench:         122 ns/iter (+/- 2)
test compressible_simple_hit   ... bench:          42 ns/iter (+/- 1)
test compressible_simple_miss  ... bench:         122 ns/iter (+/- 2)

After (with phf):
test compressible_complex_hit  ... bench:          76 ns/iter (+/- 1)
test compressible_complex_miss ... bench:          67 ns/iter (+/- 22)
test compressible_simple_hit   ... bench:          19 ns/iter (+/- 0)
test compressible_simple_miss  ... bench:          67 ns/iter (+/- 6)
```

candidates.title: perf(serde_v8): zero-copy StringOrBuffer
candidates.body:
```
Before:
test de_sob_buf_16kb      ... bench:         597 ns/iter (+/- 16)
test de_sob_buf_1b        ... bench:          90 ns/iter (+/- 3)
test de_sob_buf_1kb       ... bench:         169 ns/iter (+/- 3)
test de_sob_buf_512kb     ... bench:      23,829 ns/iter (+/- 441)
test de_sob_str_1kb       ... bench:         555 ns/iter (+/- 6)
test de_sob_str_6b        ... bench:          76 ns/iter (+/- 0)

After:
test de_sob_buf_16kb      ... bench:          32 ns/iter (+/- 1)
test de_sob_buf_1b        ... bench:          32 ns/iter (+/- 2)
test de_sob_buf_1kb       ... bench:          32 ns/iter (+/- 1)
test de_sob_buf_512kb     ... bench:          32 ns/iter (+/- 2)
test de_sob_str_1kb       ... bench:         465 ns/iter (+/- 14)
test de_sob_str_6b        ... bench:          48 ns/iter (+/- 1)
```

candidates.title: feat(ext/net): add `NS` DNS record support
candidates.body:
<!--
Before submitting a PR, please read http://deno.land/manual/contributing

1. Give the PR a descriptive title.

  Examples of good title:
    - fix(std/http): Fix race condition in server
    - docs(console): Update docstrings
    - feat(doc): Handle nested reexports

  Examples of bad title:
    - fix #7123
    - update docs
    - fix bugs

2. Ensure there is a related issue and it is referenced in the PR text.
3. Ensure there are tests that cover the changes.
4. Ensure `cargo test` passes.
5. Ensure `./tools/format.js` passes without changing files.
6. Ensure `./tools/lint.js` passes.
-->
Adding `NS` DNS record using `Name` struct. For resolving name server record to delegates a DNS zone to use the given with [RFC 1035](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc1035#page-12).
Closes #14355

candidates.title: feat(ext/http): stream auto resp body compression
candidates.body:
This commit adds support for auto response body compression for
streaming bodies.

Alternative to https://github.com/denoland/deno/tree/compression_stream
that uses `async_compression` and tokio's io traits.

cc @AaronO @satyarohith 

Fixes #13835

candidates.title: perf(fmt/lint): incremental formatting and linting
candidates.body:
## Formatting

Before on deno_std:

```ps
> Measure-Command { deno fmt } | Select-Object -Property TotalMilliseconds
Checked 929 files

TotalMilliseconds
-----------------
          414.208
> Measure-Command { deno fmt } | Select-Object -Property TotalMilliseconds
Checked 929 files

TotalMilliseconds
-----------------
         415.6013
```

After (see second run):

```ps
> Measure-Command { ../deno/target/release/deno fmt } | Select-Object -Property TotalMilliseconds
Checked 929 files

TotalMilliseconds
-----------------
         415.8299
> Measure-Command { ../deno/target/release/deno fmt } | Select-Object -Property TotalMilliseconds
Checked 929 files

TotalMilliseconds
-----------------
         118.6008
```

## Linting

Before on deno_std:

```
> Measure-Command { deno lint } | Select-Object -Property TotalMilliseconds
Checked 873 files

TotalMilliseconds
-----------------
         464.5036
> Measure-Command { deno lint } | Select-Object -Property TotalMilliseconds
Checked 873 files

TotalMilliseconds
-----------------
         461.2106
```

After (see second run... first run is just by chance faster):

```
> Measure-Command { ../deno/target/release/deno lint } | Select-Object -Property TotalMilliseconds
Checked 873 files

TotalMilliseconds
-----------------
         451.739

V:\deno_std [main ↑10 +0 ~1 -0 !]
> Measure-Command { ../deno/target/release/deno lint } | Select-Object -Property TotalMilliseconds
Checked 873 files

TotalMilliseconds
-----------------
          114.018
```

This will be a big performance improvement if people cache their DENO_DIR on the CI too (the 400ms above is with 20 cores which would be much slower with only 2 cores on GH actions). Edit: Actually, the cache would need to be keyed on the CLI version... I'm not sure how that could work.

Closes #10906

candidates.title: feat(bench): new console reporter
candidates.body: This commit replaces basic benchmarks reporter with a pretty table, and adds group and baseline options. fixes #14022 fixes #14149 closes #13929 closes #14015

candidates.title: fix(fmt): regression where some short if stmt headers being split on multiple lines
candidates.body:
Closes #14291

Fix is here: https://github.com/dprint/dprint/commit/cefcd6ab456cd30cb3d0c309ebdfbf92ecd5b9d4#diff-dc718d439788fa89bb0b7317f7fc141ec15f785eec249140a6410afdf759a32cR451 (recently introduced this concept of line number anchors and it's not being prevalently used yet... looks like it was completely broken)
Added tests to dprint-plugin-typescript here: https://github.com/dprint/dprint-plugin-typescript/commit/6730a78aac305753628edc51596c2a85a9b16bd9#diff-f9f0652914f42c41030eb0a0815d7aaeb2903364c18918f527abb240d9e0e48bR1-R42

candidates.title: refactor: Move source map lookups to core
candidates.body: This had been blocking lots of other cleanups as well. Namely the following transformations gradually faced by `JsError` have all been moved up front to `JsError::from_v8_exception()`: finding the first non-`deno:` source line [[old code]](https://github.com/denoland/deno/blob/f7e7f548499eff8d2df0872d1340ddcdfa028c45/cli/source_maps.rs#L60-L80); moving `JsError::script_resource_name` etc. into the first error stack in case of syntax errors [[old code]](https://github.com/denoland/deno/blob/f7e7f548499eff8d2df0872d1340ddcdfa028c45/cli/fmt_errors.rs#L259-L273); source mapping `JsError::script_resource_name` etc. when wrapping the error even though the frame locations are source mapped earlier [[old code]](https://github.com/denoland/deno/blob/f7e7f548499eff8d2df0872d1340ddcdfa028c45/cli/main.rs#L132-L133); removing `JsError::{script_resource_name,line_number,start_column,end_column}` entirely in favour of `js_error.frames.get(0)`. We also no longer pass a js-side callback to `core/02_error.js` from cli. I avoided doing this on previous occasions because the source map lookups were in an awkward place.

candidates.title: feat(test): format user code output
candidates.body: Closes https://github.com/denoland/deno/issues/14192 This commit changes "deno test" to better denote user output coming from test cases. This is done by printing "---- output ----" and "---- output end ----" markers if an output is produced. The output from "console" and "Deno.core.print" is captured, as well as direct writes to "Deno.stdout" and "Deno.stderr". To achieve that new APIs were added to "deno_core" crate, that allow to replace an existing resource with a different one (while keeping resource ids intact). Resources for stdout and stderr are replaced by pipes.

candidates.title: fix: upgrade to swc_ecmascript 0.143
candidates.body:
- Upgrades to deno_ast 0.14
- Upgrades to the latest dprint plugins which have perf improvements and bug fixes
- This supports parsing source files with missing close braces, which should help improve our editor support.

Closes #14181
